messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 535
messages.msgSnippet: **Ours ask, Is this for classroom use? Ick. But, yes.** The last time I bought books at Barnes and Noble I was buying them for a friend s birthday.  I
messages.messageBody:
**Ours ask, "Is this for classroom use?"

Ick.

But, yes.**

The last time I bought books at Barnes and Noble I was buying them for a
friend's birthday. I figured that that was a "No".

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 535
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/22/2002 11:29:28 AM Pacific Daylight Time, ... After reading the first one, I didn t really want to read the others -- the first was too
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/22/2002 11:29:28 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> What I found most interesting (though not surprising) was that one or two
> people posted negative reviews, then a few others thanked them for warning
> them and said they'd never read the books.

After reading the first one, I didn't really want to read the others -- the
first was too disturbing. Then, after a year or so, I was ready for the
others -- liked them a lot but they were not NEARLY as disturbing.

--pam

National Home Education Network
http://www.NHEN.org
Changing the Way the World Sees Homeschooling!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 535
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/22/2002 11:29:28 AM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Ours ask, Is this for classroom use? Ick. But, yes. --pam National Home Education Network
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/22/2002 11:29:28 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> At the Barnes & Noble here, when you show your homeschool card, you get a %
> off all "educational" purchases. But the checkout clerks always ask, "Is
> this
> for school/educational purposes?" I proudly say,"Yes! Everything counts!
> It's ALL educational!" as I pay for the newest Scooby-Doo paperback, the
> Myst
> gaming cheatbook, three boardgames, and a puzzle!.

Ours ask, "Is this for classroom use?"

Ick.

But, yes.

--pam

National Home Education Network
http://www.NHEN.org
Changing the Way the World Sees Homeschooling!
